definition: to attend to the needs of (an invalid, disabled person etc)/caregiver
to accompany/to keep sb company/to assist/old variant of 賠|赔[pei2]

sentences.english: It is a long-standing problem in hospital management on professional caregivers.
sentences.chinese: 醫院職業陪護一直是醫院管理中的老大難問題。

sentences.english: Because his parents chaperoned him once too.
sentences.chinese: 因爲他的父母也曾經陪護過他一次。

sentences.english: Are there any escort services that don’t peddle sex?
sentences.chinese: 那麼究竟有沒有不兜售性服務的陪護呢？

sentences.english: Drug users may also hire escorts to accompany them while they get high.
sentences.chinese: 吸毒的人或許還會在亢奮後租用陪護人員來看護他們。

definition: to show every possible consideration (idiom); meticulous care
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
night and day (idiom); continuous strenuous effort
can talk really well (idiom); the gift of the gab
benevolent heart and skillful execution (idiom, from Mencius); charitable in thought and deed
protective umbrella/fig. person affording protection (esp. corrupt)
sharp ears and keen eyes (idiom)/keen and alert/perceptive
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
